title: Native HTML Elements All In One Page - Minimal Markup Reference Page by Ronnie Smith
description: Test drive native HTML elements on your device.
body: HOMENative HTML Elements All In One Page - Minimal Markup Reference PageThis page utilizes every native HTML element. In other words, you are looking at the entire set of native HTML elements. Your web browser renders the markup as you see it now. The purpose of this page is to illustrate HTML behavior for web developers. Note: default style sheets are applied by your browser.Metadata ContentMetadata elements are included in the document head and are not displayed but appear in the page source code.Flow ContentMost elements in the document body are categorized as flow content.Embedded And Interactive ContentSelect: Lecture 01: Powers of TenLecture 02: 1D KinematicsLecture 03: VectorsLecture 01: What holds our world together?Lecture 02: Electric FieldLecture 03: Electric FluxLecture 01: Periodic PhenomenonLecture 02: BeatsLecture 03: Forced Oscillations with Damping An alternative text describing what your canvas displays.Anchor Elements and Button elements are interactive. This is a text area: Click Me To See Video And Audio ElementsDownloadDownload the WEBM or MP4 video.Input Elements TypesBlack White GrayscaleRange: Bound To Datalist:  Password: Date: Month: Week: Time: Datetime Local: Email: Color: Number: File:Heading, Sectioning, and Phrasing ContentWe can supercript and subscript text. This whole sentence is in a samp element. and we can markup a variable n too. Keyboard elements display like Shift + F3. There are definition elements in HTML. Ruby elements allow for textabove（. Dates and times are placed in time elements, e.g., 2011-11. There is a quote element too. Bold elements and u element and even italics too. The direction of the words can be backwards or deleted. Emphasis. The strong emphasis on marked text. Andthis is text nested in a pre elementThis blockquote element comes directly from HTML: The Living Standard.My Table Captionthead headerQuantitytable row data10table row data400tfoot headerTenorderedlistmenulistunorderedlistBirdsAnimals with wings.Figure Caption.This is a form element. +  =The progress element:20%The meter element:6 blocks used (out of 8 total)External LinkThis is a dialog element.New Orleanslet x = "";

Communication

There are various methods of communication. This section covers a few of the important ones used by the project.

Communication stones seem to come in pairs and have mysterious properties:

  • They can transfer thoughts in two directions once activated if used alone.
  • If used with another device, they can transfer one's consciousness to another body.
  • If both stones are used with another device, the consciousnesses switch bodies.

Radios use the electromagnetic spectrum in the meter range and longer.

Signal flares use the electromagnetic spectrum in the nanometer range.

Food

All food at the project is rationed:

Potatoes
Two per day
Soup
One bowl per day

Cooking is done by the chefs on a set rotation.

    My use of language and my cats

    My cat's behavior hasn't changed much since her absence, except that she plays her new physique to the neighbors regularly, in an attempt to get pets.

    My other cat, coloured black and white, is a sweetie. He followed us to the pool today, walking down the pavement with us. Yesterday he apparently visited our neighbours. I wonder if he recognises that their flat is a mirror image of ours.

    Hm, I just noticed that in the last paragraph I used British English. But I'm supposed to write in American English. So I shouldn't say "pavement" or "flat" or "colour"...

    I should say "sidewalk" and "apartment" and "color"!

title: Schema.org Vocabulary Browser
description: The vocabulary is loaded from Schema.org's developers page and organized according to the properties shared among the terms.

title: Structured Data Browser
description: These best practices are programmatically gathered directly from Google. A machine gets the list of Google Cloud products from cloud.google.com/products and then iteratively searches site:cloud.google.com for each products best practices. Only the top ten results are displayed.

            var doc = document;
            var res;
            var continents = doc.getElementById('continents');
            var regions = doc.getElementById('regions');
            var minutes = doc.getElementById('minutes');
            var hours = doc.getElementById('hours');
            var days = doc.getElementById('days');
            var months = doc.getElementById('months');
            var year = doc.getElementById('year');
            var result = doc.getElementById('result');
            var submit = doc.getElementById('submit');
            var adjustedHour = 0;
            var utcTime = 0;
            var offsetScrubbed;
            var stringTime = '';
            var stringTimeFormatted = '';
            var resultText = '';
                
            $.each(timezones, function(k, v) {
                var continentOption = doc.createElement('option');
                var continentText = doc.createTextNode(toTitleCase(k));
                continentOption.appendChild(continentText);
                continents.appendChild(continentOption);
            });
            $('select').material_select();
            
            $.each(times.minutes, function(k, v) {
                var minutesOption = doc.createElement('option');
                var minutesText = doc.createTextNode(v);
                minutesOption.appendChild(minutesText);
                minutesOption.value = v;
                minutes.appendChild(minutesOption);
            });
            
            $.each(times.hours, function(k, v) {
                var hoursOption = doc.createElement('option');
                var hoursText = doc.createTextNode(k);
                hoursOption.value = v;
                hoursOption.appendChild(hoursText);
                hours.appendChild(hoursOption);                
            });
                
            $.each(times.days, function(k, v) {
                var daysOption = doc.createElement('option');
                var daysText = doc.createTextNode(k);
                daysOption.value = v;
                daysOption.appendChild(daysText);
                days.appendChild(daysOption);
            });
            
            $.each(times.months, function(k, v) {
                var monthsOption = doc.createElement('option');
                var monthsText = doc.createTextNode(toTitleCase(v));
                monthsOption.value = k;
                monthsOption.appendChild(monthsText);
                months.appendChild(monthsOption);
            });
            
            $('select').material_select();
            
            continents.onchange = function() {
                regions.innerHTML = '';
                
                $.each(timezones[this.value.toLowerCase()], function(k, v) {
                    var regionsOption = doc.createElement('option');
                    var regionsText = doc.createTextNode(toTitleCase(k));
                    regionsOption.appendChild(regionsText);
                    regionsOption.value = v;
                    regions.appendChild(regionsOption);
                });            
                $('select').material_select();
            };
                
            submit.addEventListener("click", function() {
                var timeframe = $("input[name='timeframe']:checked").val();
                if(regions.value && months.value && days.value && year.value && hours.value && minutes.value && timeframe){
                    result.innerHTML='';
                    if(timeframe == 'pm'){
                        adjustedHour = (hours.value * 1) + 12;
                    } else {
                        adjustedHour = hours.value * 1;
                    }
                    
                    offsetScrubbed = regions.value.replace("UTC", "").replace(":", "");
                    
                    stringTime = months.value + ' ' + days.value + ' ' + year.value + ' ' + adjustedHour + minutes.value + ':00 ' + offsetScrubbed;
                    stringTimeFormatted = months.value + ' ' + days.value + ', ' + year.value + ' ' + adjustedHour + minutes.value + ' ' + timeframe + ' (' + regions.value + ')';
                    utcTime = new Date(stringTime);
                    
                    resultText = doc.createTextNode(utcTime.getTime() + ' = ' + stringTimeFormatted);
                    result.className = "uppercase";
                    result.appendChild(resultText);
                } else {
                    Materialize.toast('All fields required', 4000);
                }
            });
            
            function toTitleCase(str)
            {
                return str.replace(/\w\S*/g, function(txt){return txt.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + txt.substr(1).toLowerCase();});
            }  
        }());
